Description: A brief description of a feature from the end-user perspective.
A large body of work that can be broken down into smaller user stories.
Conditions that a user story must satisfy to be considered complete.
A requirement that specifies a system behavior or function.
A requirement that specifies system attributes like performance, security, or usability.
A concept in software development that reflects the implied cost of additional rework caused by choosing an easy solution now instead of using a better approach that would take longer.
A mnemonic for the characteristics of a good user story: Independent, Negotiable, Valuable, Estimable, Small, Testable.
A measure of the effort required to implement a requirement, often assessed through NLP techniques.
A relationship between requirements where one requirement cannot be completed without another.
A lack of clarity in a requirement that may lead to misinterpretation.
A technique used to determine the emotional tone behind words to assess the complexity or clarity of requirements.
A method of analyzing the occurrence of specific words in requirements to identify key themes or areas of focus.
A field of AI that focuses on the interaction between computers and humans through natural language.
